revised_title: Antigenic Variation and Immune Evasion in Malaria Parasites
tldr: This article discusses the phenomenon of antigenic variation in bloodstage malaria parasites, specifically in Plasmodium knowlesi. The author explains how these parasites can evade the host's immune system by changing the surface antigens, allowing them to establish chronic infections and resist reinfection. The article also explores the implications of antigenic variation for malaria control and potential future research directions.
